subject: Self Care
title: How Apps Hijack Your Brain
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on How Apps Hijack Your Brain.

hook.text: You opened Instagram to check one thing. Forty-five minutes vanished. The app was designed to do exactly that.

buildup.text: Tech companies employ attention engineers who use behavioral psychology to maximize time on their apps.

discovery.text: Variable reward schedules â€” like slot machines â€” keep you scrolling. Sometimes you find gold. Usually you don't. You keep trying.

twist.text: The product isn't the app. You are the product. Your attention is sold to advertisers by the second.

climax.text: Awareness is the first defense. When you understand the manipulation, you can choose to resist it deliberately.

punchline.text: Apps are designed to addict. Know the tricks and resist them.

quiz.question: What psychological principle keeps users scrolling endlessly?
options: Variable reward schedules similar to slot machines
